# the [[world]]; everything under the sky; all under heaven
#* {{zh-x|天下 莫 大於 秋豪 之 末，而 大山 為{wéi} 小；莫 壽於 殤子，而 ^彭祖 為{wéi} 夭。天地 與 我 並存，而 萬物 與 我 為 一。|There is nothing '''under the canopy of heaven''' greater than the tip of an autumn spikelet. A vast mountain is a small thing. Neither is there any age greater than that of a child cut off in infancy. P'êng Tsu himself died young. The universe and I came into being together; and I, and everything therein, are {{sc|One}}.|CL|ref={{circa|369 {{B.C.E.}} – 286 {{B.C.E.}}}} {{w2|zh|莊子}} ({{w|Zhuangzi (book)|''Zhuangzi''}}), {{w2|zh|s:莊子/齊物論|齊物論}} ([[s:Chuang_Tzŭ_(Giles)/Chapter_2|The Identity of Contraries]])}}
